Package com.csse3200.game.components.npc.attack

Class AttackComponent

java.lang.Object
com.csse3200.game.components.Component
com.csse3200.game.components.npc.attack.AttackComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
AttackBehaviour
Direct Known Subclasses:
AOEAttackComponent, MeleeAttackComponent, RangeAttackComponent
public abstract class AttackComponent extends Component implements AttackBehaviour
Abstract class that handles attack logic for an NPC, applying damage and effects to a target within range.

  • Constructor Details

    • AttackComponent

      public AttackComponent(Entity target, float attackRange, float attackRate, EffectConfig[] effectConfigs)
      Makes an attack component
      Parameters:
      target - The target entity for the attack.
      attackRange - The range of the attack.
      attackRate - The rate of the attack.
      effectConfigs - The effect configurations to apply on the target.

  • Method Details

    • create

      public void create()
      Description copied from class: Component
      Called when the entity is created and registered. Initial logic such as calls to GetComponent should be made here, not in the constructor which is called before an entity is finished.
      Overrides:
      create in class Component

    • update

      public void update()
      Description copied from class: Component
      Called once per frame of the game, and should be used for most component logic. Not called if component is disabled.
      Overrides:
      update in class Component

    • applyEffects

      protected void applyEffects(Entity target)
      Applies effects to the target entity by adding them to the target's EffectComponent.
      Parameters:
      target - The entity being attacked.

    • canAttack

      public boolean canAttack(Entity attacker, Entity target)
      Description copied from interface: AttackBehaviour
      Check if the attacker can attack the target.
      Specified by:
      canAttack in interface AttackBehaviour
      Parameters:
      attacker - The entity performing the attack.
      target - The entity being attacked.
      Returns:
      True if the attacker can attack the target, false otherwise.

    • enableForNumAttacks

      public void enableForNumAttacks(int numberOfAttacks)
      Enable the attack component for a given number of attacks.
      Parameters:
      numberOfAttacks - Number of attacks to enable for.
